de.mrapp.android.tabswitcher.layout

Interface Arithmetics

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractArithmetics, PhoneArithmetics, TabletArithmetics

    public interface Arithmetics
    Defines the interface, a class, which provides methods, which allow to calculate the position, size and rotation of a TabSwitcher's children, must implement.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Arithmetics.Axis
      Contains all axes on which the tabs of a TabSwitcher can be moved.

    • Method Detail

      • getTabSwitcherPadding

        int getTabSwitcherPadding(@NonNull
                          Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                          int gravity)
        Returns the padding of the tab switcher on a specific axis and using a specific gravity.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        gravity - The gravity as an Integer value. The gravity must be Gravity.START or Gravity.END
        Returns:
        The padding of the tab switcher on the given axis and using the given gravity as an Integer value

      • getTabContainerSize

        float getTabContainerSize(@NonNull
                          Arithmetics.Axis axis)
        Returns the size of the container, which contains the tab switcher's tabs, on a specific axis. By default, the padding and the size of the toolbars are included.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        Returns:
        The size of the container, which contains the tab switcher's tabs, on the given axis as a Float value

      • getTabContainerSize

        float getTabContainerSize(@NonNull
                          Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                          boolean includePadding)
        Returns the size of the container, which contains the tab switcher's tabs, on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        includePadding - True, if the padding and the size of the toolbars should be included, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The size of the container, which contains the tab switcher's tabs, on the given axis as a Float value

      • getTouchPosition

        float getTouchPosition(@NonNull
                       Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                       @NonNull
                       android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Returns the position of a touch event on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        event - The touch event, whose position should be returned, as an instance of the class MotionEvent. The motion event may not be null
        Returns:
        The position of the given touch event on the given axis as a Float value

      • getPosition

        float getPosition(@NonNull
                  Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                  @NonNull
                  AbstractItem item)
        Returns the position of a specific item on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        item - The item, whose position should be returned, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The position of the given item on the given axis as a Float value

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(@NonNull
                 Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                 @NonNull
                 AbstractItem item,
                 float position)
        Sets the position of an item on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        item - The item, whose position should be set, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        position - The position, which should be set, as a Float value

      • animatePosition

        void animatePosition(@NonNull
                     Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                     @NonNull
                     android.view.ViewPropertyAnimator animator,
                     @NonNull
                     AbstractItem item,
                     float position)
        Animates the position of an item on a specific axis. By default, the item's padding is not taken into account.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        animator - The animator, which should be used to animate the position, as an instance of the class ViewPropertyAnimator. The animator may not be null
        item - The item, whose position should be animated, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        position - The position, which should be set by the animation, as a Float value

      • animatePosition

        void animatePosition(@NonNull
                     Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                     @NonNull
                     android.view.ViewPropertyAnimator animator,
                     @NonNull
                     AbstractItem item,
                     float position,
                     boolean includePadding)
        Animates the position of an item on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        animator - The animator, which should be used to animate the position, as an instance of the class ViewPropertyAnimator. The animator may not be null
        item - The item, whose position should be animated, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        position - The position, which should be set by the animation, as a Float value
        includePadding - True, if the item's padding should be taken into account, false otherwise

      • getScale

        float getScale(@NonNull
               AbstractItem item)
        Returns the scale of an item, depending on its margin. By default, the item's padding is not taken into account.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose scale should be returned, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        Returns:
        The scale of the given item as a Float value

      • getScale

        float getScale(@NonNull
               AbstractItem item,
               boolean includePadding)
        Returns the scale of an item, depending on its margin.
        Parameters:
        item - The item, whose scale should be returned, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        includePadding - True, if the item's padding should be taken into account as well, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The scale of the given item as a Float value

      • setScale

        void setScale(@NonNull
              Arithmetics.Axis axis,
              @NonNull
              AbstractItem item,
              float scale)
        Sets the scale of an item on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        item - The item, whose scale should be set, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        scale - The scale, which should be set, as a Float value

      • getPivot

        float getPivot(@NonNull
               Arithmetics.Axis axis,
               @NonNull
               AbstractItem item,
               @NonNull
               AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.DragState dragState)
        Returns the pivot of an item on a specific axis, depending on the current drag state.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        item - The item, whose pivot should be returned, as an instance of the class AbstractItem. The item may not be null
        dragState - The current drag state as a value of the enum AbstractDragTabsEventHandler.DragState. The drag state may not be null
        Returns:
        The pivot of the given item on the given axis as a Float value

              @NonNull

        Sets the pivot of an item on a specific axis.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis as a value of the enum Arithmetics.Axis. The axis may not be null
        item - The item, whose pivot should be set, as an instance of the class View. The item may not be null
        pivot - The pivot, which should be set, as a Float value

        void animateRotation(@NonNull
                     Arithmetics.Axis axis,
                     @NonNull
                     android.view.ViewPropertyAnimator animator,

        Parameters:

        animator - The animator, should be used to animate the rotation, as an instance of the class ViewPropertyAnimator. The animator may not be null
        angle - The rotation, which should be set by the animation, as a Float value
